title.native: デリコズ・ナーサリー

description:
Hailing from the prestigious noble house of Delico, Dali Delico is an elite member of the Blood Pact Council with a promising future. When the Blood Pact Council, the highest governing body for the Vamps, assigns a special mission to Dali, he flatly refuses it. Having lost patience, Gerhard, Dino, and Henrique, who are also Council members serving the same term as Dali, rush to the house of Delico to persuade him. What they witness there is Dali, taking care of an infant himself… Meanwhile, there has been a series of mysterious murders targeting Vamps. And Dali seems to have a history with Pendulum, an antisocial organization that's thought to be the mastermind behind these murders… This is the record of the nobless oblige scramble of child-rearing by the noble Vamps. Can they find the right balance of their absolute mission and childcare in this magnificent gothic world?!

(Source: Crunchyroll)

Note: 'Delico's Nursery' is a completely new work based on Kenichi Suemitsu's 'TRUMP' stage play and serves as a sequel to the 'Grand Guignol' 2017 stage play in the series.
hashtag: #デリコズ・ナーサリー #デリコズ

COCOON

name.native: テオドール・クラシコ

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/nishiki_hiroshi)

He is unilaterally liked by [Kunihiko Ikuhara](https://anilist.co/staff/100082/Kunihiko-Ikuhara). His work on [Revolutionary Girl Utena](https://anilist.co/anime/440/Revolutionary-Girl-Utena/) storyboards were outright claimed to be the "closest to his own style" , in principle, by Ikuhara himself.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/濱野高年)

Affiliated with Magic Capsule.
Affiliated with [J.C. Staff](https://anilist.co/studio/7/), where he is one of the art directors.

[Official Website](https://www.mikanakashima.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/nakashima_mika_) | [Blog](https://lineblog.me/nakashimamika/) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/mikanakashima_official/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/user/mikanakashimaSMEJ)

She had always dreamed of becoming a singer since a child. She decided not to attend high school, and pursued her dream in a musical career.  

The very first demo tape she sent to a record company had given her the chance. She was chosen out of 3000 girls to be the heroine of the 2001 fall season drama “Kizudarake no Love Song (Scarred Love Song)” on Fuji TV. In November, she made her debut with Sony Music Associated Records, with the song “STARS," which was also the theme song of the drama. Her second single “CRESCENT MOON,” a groovy track with an 80’s flavor, was a limited product with only 100,000 copies. Amazingly, it sold out the first day of its release. In March 2002, she released her third single “ONE SURVIVE” and her first video “FILM LOTUS”; in May, her 4th single “HELPLESS RAIN”; in August, her 5th single “WILL."

In December 2006, Mika released “Hitoiro” for the NANA 2 movie under the name “NANA starring MIKA NAKASHIMA,” as well as a NANA album titled “THE END,” marking the conclusion of her association with NANA.

Jad is an American voice actress and ADR director who works for Funimation and Sentai Filmworks. Her name is an acronym of her parents' names, Jimmy and David, and is pronounced as Jade. Her singing led to her first voice role in Sasami: Magical Girls Club as Eimi Mori, and her first major voice role was Masako Hara in Ghost Hunt. She graduated summa cum laude from Texas Wesleyan University with a Bachelor of Arts in Music in 2005.

(Source: Wikipedia)
ADR Engineer at FUNimation Entertainment, however has since expanded to also being a Mixing Engineer.
